intro: Caladenia ustulata, commonly known as the red-tipped spider orchid, is an herbaceous plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, intricate flowers. The flowers are typically pale green to yellowish with a distinctive red or orange tip on the labellum, which is a specialized petal. It grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in open woodlands or heathlands, and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions. The plant is pollinated by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
